name: Lola House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights and Lidia, Ana and staff could not have been more welcoming. A lovely room, comfortable bed, nice bathroom - everything a traveler can ask for. Nothing was too much trouble - thank you so much. Go to Roberto's restaurant and Pain de Arte - really good food and 5 mins. from Lola House.
reviews.title: Incredibly friendly, helpful, comfortable place to stay

reviews.text: Justifies its excellent ratings on Tripadvisor. Family hotel within a few minutes walk of Boedo subway station, which was fine for accessing the tourist areas of BA. Incredible hospitality from the staff. Quiet for good sleep. All you can eat breakfast. Good restaurants near the subway entrance. Planned 3 nights but stayed 6. Will visit again. Thanks!
reviews.title: Fabulous hospitality in very comfortable family hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked through Hotels.com for A$90 per night including breakfast. Firstly, being able to find a place like this is the reason why people like me spend so much time submitting reviews to Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Contender for World Effusiveness Championship

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When arriving, remember that you are looking for a bright yellow house with the right number, not a hotel sign. There was a good sense of security here; one rings the bell and the door is opened with a friendly greeting. There is someone at the desk 24 hours.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel,fabulous staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are in a lovely old house around an open courtyard, so each is different. If you are looking for a sleep-in, you may prefer not to have No 5 as the bedhead is on the other side of the wall from the scullery sink. The rooms are clean and comfortable and pleasantly decorated. They have a television and free wireless internet. There is not a lot of places to put things in the bathroom. What makes Lola House so special is the two charming ladies who own it and their friendly staff. I was hugged and kissed, plied with good food at breakfast and made to feel like an old friend. Importantly they would start the day with a free map and a pen to help us plan our day. I left feeling that I had made the most of our time in Buenos Aires.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Lola House really does live up to the praise lavished upon it by other reviews. While some visitors might wish that the B&B was picked up and transplanted to a more touristy part of Buenos Aires, any visitor would be hard pressed to find a hotel that cares about your stay more than this one! Read on for more...
reviews.title: Unsurpassed hospitality for an excellent stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION:
reviews.title: Cozy, Accomadating & Good Price

reviews.text: Lola House is located in the Boedo neighborhood, about 2 blocks away from the Boedo subway entrance, on Line E. If you're looking for the place on a BA tourist map... don't bother. Most of the tourist maps won't extend out to this neighborhood. But don't let that stop you!! You're only 10 minutes and ARS$1.1 from the center of downtown using the subway, or even faster by inexpensive taxi, which anyone at the hotel will arrange for you. The hotel is approximately 40 minutes (depending on traffic) from Ezeiza airport. The Boedo neighborhood is a classic Porteño neighborhood, without almost anything in the way of tourist services or support -- but by way of compromise, there is some truly excellent and inexpensive shopping for clothing and other essentials, as well as quite a few very good restaurants that won't have lines out-the-door for a well-prepared and inexpensive meal.
reviews.title: When on business in Buenos Aires, BE in Buenos Aires!

reviews.text: PROPERTY:
reviews.title: Best Service ... ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lola House building is a classic BA open-courtyard home. Once through the front reception area, the inside of the house opens onto two broad courtyards, open to the sky, with furniture to relax in and enjoy the sunlight. Spirited board or card games among guests, or guests and the owners & staff, are a common sight! In addition to the morning breakfast area, there is a public computer terminal upstairs from reception. There is a kitchen on the property, and the staff graciously used it to heat up a late lunch for us, that we'd brought in late one afternoon, ravenously hungry.
reviews.title: Lola , best staff in the industry

reviews.text: I stayed here with several friends on a return from Antarctica. Every single member of the hotel staff was amazing. They were sweet and helpful. They bent over backwards to accommodate several large requests from our group, with no incentive other than to deliver top notch assistance. They were wonderful folk, and I'd highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing people, and a great place to stay

reviews.text: There is really nothing more that can be added to the over 300 positive reviews of this place - yes, it is in the Barrio de Boedo (where?) on a nondescript street, with barely a sign plate that proclaims "Lola House".... where am I... probably the first question that pops in one's head as one steps out from the cab....
reviews.title: Amazingly stupendously fabulously Fantastic Home away from Home!

reviews.text: 25 to 40 pesos gets you virtually anywhere in BA's tourist haunts. A short (I didnt feel unsafe at all) pleasant 5 min walk gets you to the subway, and for 1.1 peso, hop on the subway to downtown BA.
reviews.title: Lovely guesthouse with amazingly friendly service!

reviews.text: Hungry? Cross the Boedo street on San Juan (across from the subway entrance), and there is this "El Porteno de Boedo" mini restaurant, run by a very friendly Lebanese couple - lots of food (the usual meats, empanadas, tiramisu etc - check out their Tabuleh at decent prices....
reviews.title: Colorful place with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But it is Lola House that steals the cake - the physical facilities are cute - clean, well maintained, but strip them of the spirit of Ana/Lydia/Sebastian, and Lola House becomes a good but not necessarily a great place to stay. It is their enthusiasm and enjoyment of welcoming guests into their "home", that sweeps one into the excitement and joy of staying at Lola House. From the first welcome, to the long conversations about trips, places where one has been, discussions on what is happening in other places in the world, to long breakfasts (be careful here - bring a hungry stomach - Ana will feed you well!) , the whole experience is one of a kind - there is nothing "serviced" about this service - it feels genuine from the heart and truly makes one feel like visiting with a long lost familiar friend.
reviews.title: Lola House is that specila house where we discovered friendliness, comfort and a home away from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I arrived at Lola House mid-morning (it must have been before check-in), weary from an overnight bus to BA from Mendoza. We were ushered in and immediately set down to an extensive breakfast. No worries that we were early, our room was ready (hooray shower!) and we set off on our day feeling refreshed after a map of both the immediate area and Buenos Aires as a whole was given to us with noting and conversation of points of interest.
reviews.title: Lola House, in cheery yellow, makes us smile in remembrance

reviews.text: Lola House is about 2 blocks from a Subte stop in an area that we felt extremely comfortable walking in (with a digital SLR out), which was sadly not the case in some of the other areas we visited in BA. Our room was quite large, the wifi worked perfectly, the shower had good water pressure, and we felt quite at home. At all times, someone spoke English at the front desk, and they were very helpful in making reservations/bookings for us (from ferry tickets to Uruguay to cabs).
reviews.title: Fantastic experience! A+++++++++++++++++++++++++

reviews.text: The sisters that run Lola House, as well as the remainder of the staff made our stay very enjoyable - we did not want to leave. Thank you to them for making the end of our trip a pleasant one!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel with Excellent Service -- A Must Stay

reviews.text: I only have positives to say about the ladies and Santi at Lola House. They will make you feel extremely welcome and part of the 'family' for however long you are there. I stayed just over 10 days in 2 different rooms as I went to Mar De Plata for a few days based on their advice which was a lot of fun. Both the rooms are extremely clean and are cleaned daily. The breakfasts they provide will fill you all the way up to lunchtime. The staff will go out their way to help and make your stay one to remember. They give fantastic advice of where to go and what to do! Definite value for money and a rare case of a hotel that I will always return to when in Buenos Aires.
reviews.title: Argentinian hospitality epitomised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a hidden gem. Its in a beautiful building which has a cute outside area which our room was off of. The room was very clean and spacious. The location was great as well. There are alot of great restaurants just ~2 blocks away and its a quick ~10-20 min cab ride (depending on traffic) to Palermo/Recoleta, etc. which is not bad at all considering that everything seems to be quite a distance in the city. The service, though, it what truly makes this hotel amazing. All of the staff were extraordinarily helpful and so nice. I would highly recommend this to all of my friends.
reviews.title: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!

description: A new concept in lodging. In Boedo tango district, a large late XIX century house. Rooms with private bath. Breakfast included. Welcome drink. Air conditioner. Cable T.V. Snack bar. Reading room.
